ygData.subject: Re: hey there
ygData.msgSnippet: Hello!  I am also one of the older women playing EQ, I am 32.  My husband and oldest daughter (12) also play.  We love to play to together, and since we do
ygData.messageBody:
Hello! I am also one of the older women playing EQ, I am 32. My husband
and oldest daughter (12) also play. We love to play to together, and since
we do have two computers, at least two of us play every day. Now that
school is out my daughter is doing great and making some wonderful friends
in Norrath. My main character is a level 15 dark elf Cleric named Kilanna on
Veeshan. I also have a high elf, wood elf, human, and I want to make a
gnome.
As far as the on line romance thing, I tend to concentrate more on having
fun and being as helpful to as many people as I can. I have made wonderful
friends. I am not a huge flirt but it happens <grin>.
I love to group with all kinds of people and see where it leads me.
I love reading the list and look forward to it now everyday! When you are
on Veeshan give me a tell.
----- Original Message -----
From: Shelly James <sj@...>
To: 'EQ_womenonelistcom' <EQ_women@onelist.com>
Sent: Thursday, June 17, 1999 9:05 AM
Subject: Re: [EQ_women] hey there


> From: Shelly James <sj@...>
>
> Hi
> I am Kyrah and I am a 12th lvl human Paladin on Veeshen. In answer to your
> question about getting married online, I have a RL husband who is my
online
> protector. He is a Barbarian Shaman and he is online with me 99% of the
> time. So I don't really face that problem. Most people know that we are
> married.:-)
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: ali@... [mailto:ali@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, June 16, 1999 7:10 PM
> To: EQ_women@onelist.com
> Subject: [EQ_women] hey there
>
> From: ali@...
>
> Hey everyone,
>
> I play Ardynn, a 6th-level Wood Elf Druid on the Povar server. I am fairly
> new to online roleplaying but I've been addicted to many computer RPGs in
> the past. So, I'm still working on developing Ardynn as a character. (It's
> been tough, with all those orcs chasing me all the time!)
>
> I have a question for those of you who are getting "married" online, or
> have gotten married online in the past. Do any of you have offline
> boyfriends (or husbands)? If so, do they mind if you have an online
> significant other?
>
> -Alison
>
> p.s. I think when we reply to messages on the list, we should not hit
> "reply" but instead use the EQ_women@onelist.com address - otherwise we'll
> get a lot of copies of old messages in the digests.
>
> glad to be here! looking forward to meeting all of you.
>
>
